title: NixOS Package PRs for gawk-5.2.1, dosfstools, glibc-2.37-8, shadow, util-linux-2.38.1, e2fsprogs-1.46.6 packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for gawk-5.2.1, dosfstools, glibc-2.37-8, shadow, util-linux-2.38.1, e2fsprogs-1.46.6 packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

libbsd is not supported on all architectures, e.g. microblaze.

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandboxing enabled in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
    • sandbox = relaxed
    • sandbox = true
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 24.11 Release Notes (or backporting 23.11 and 24.05 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.

Add a üëç reaction to pull requests you find important.
items.title: shadow: disable libbsd when unavailable

items.content_html:
Automatic update generated by nixpkgs-update tools. This update was made based on information from passthru.updateScript.

meta.description for wayfirePlugins.wayfire-shadows is: Wayfire plugin that adds window shadows

meta.homepage for wayfirePlugins.wayfire-shadows is: https://github.com/timgott/wayfire-shadows

Updates performed
  • Ran passthru.UpdateScript
To inspect upstream changes
  • Compare changes on GitHub
Impact

Checks done

  • built on NixOS
  • The tests defined in passthru.tests, if any, passed
  • found 0-unstable-2024-08-30 in filename of file in /nix/store/d0x6ppdcgzbp86lvrx9zg0q49sm7mfnj-wayfire-shadows-0-unstable-2024-08-30
Rebuild report (if merged into master) (click to expand) 
2 total rebuild path(s)

2 package rebuild(s)

First fifty rebuilds by attrpath

wayfirePlugins.wayfire-shadows
Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/d0x6ppdcgzbp86lvrx9zg0q49sm7mfnj-wayfire-shadows-0-unstable-2024-08-30 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A wayfirePlugins.wayfire-shadows https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/718661602abef83deca94d5c6bd6bd6c69d83de8.tar.gz

Or:

nix build github:r-ryantm/nixpkgs/718661602abef83deca94d5c6bd6bd6c69d83de8#wayfirePlugins.wayfire-shadows

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/d0x6ppdcgzbp86lvrx9zg0q49sm7mfnj-wayfire-shadows-0-unstable-2024-08-30
ls -la /nix/store/d0x6ppdcgzbp86lvrx9zg0q49sm7mfnj-wayfire-shadows-0-unstable-2024-08-30/bin

Pre-merge build results

We have automatically built all packages that will get rebuilt due to
this change.

This gives evidence on whether the upgrade will break dependent packages.
Note sometimes packages show up as failed to build independent of the
change, simply because they are already broken on the target branch.

Result of nixpkgs-review run on x86_64-linux 1

1 package built:
  • wayfirePlugins.wayfire-shadows
Maintainer pings

cc @wineee for testing.

Tip

As a maintainer, if your package is located under pkgs/by-name/*, you can comment @NixOS/nixpkgs-merge-bot merge to automatically merge this update using the nixpkgs-merge-bot.
